title: [DVD5 - Eng Ac3] Live At The Shoreline Amphitheatre
description:
[align=center][b][SIZE=4][color=red] ERIC CLAPTON WITH MARK KNOPFLER -  Live in Mountain View, California [/SIZE][/b][/color][/align]


[align=center][b][color=red] PLOT [/color]

Artists: Eric Clapton & Mark Knopfler  - Live in Mountain View, California
Title Of Album: Eric Clapton plays SHORELINE 1988
Etichetta: Beano
Anno di Pubblicazione: 1988
Genre: Rock
Source: 2 DVD

[color=red] TRACKLIST: [/color] 

	1. Crossroads
	2. White Room
	3. I Shot the Sheriff
	4. Lay Down Sally
	5. Wonderful Tonight
	6. Tearing Us Apart
	7. After Midnight
	8. Can't Find My Way Home
	9. Badge
         10. Same Old Blues
         11. Cocaine
         12. Layla
         13. Money For Nothing (Mark Knopfler)
         14. Sunshine of Your Love


[color=red] BAND LINEUP: [/color] 

Eric Clapton:	Guitar, Vocals
Mark Knopfler:	Guitar, Vocals
Nathan East:	Bass, Vocals
Steve Ferrone:	Drums
Jodie Linscott:	Percussion
Katie Kissoon:	Backing Vocals
Tessa Niles:		Backing Vocals


[color=red] SCREENSHOTS: [/color][/b]

[b][color=red] REWIEW: [/color][/b][/align]

Fantastic pro-shot quality is the hallmark of this freshman effort on the Beano label, apparently taken from the master tape.
Video tapes of varying quality from this source were available to collectors for years, and those have spawned several different releases on ROIO labels.
Perhaps the first was on the Applejack label, followed by Way of Wizards (WoW).
Another label to follow suit was Immortal, who managed to get their release into some distribution channels and into legitmate retail sources.
This show has never seen official release in any format on any label, and the Beano release is clearly superior to the others.
A great performance also featuring Mark Knopfler on guitar and Jody Linscott on braless halter top - if only gravity were just a little stronger!
Timed around the release of the groundbreaking "Crossroads" box set, the 1988 tour reinvigorated many classics, and are personal favorites.
All together, this show (and Philadelphia 1988, also on the Beano label) are essential parts of any core EC video collection.

Artwork, checksums, and info file included.

Enjoy!

[align=center][b][color=red] FEATURES DVD: [/color][/b]
